{{Football club infobox | clubname = Real Sociedad B | fullname = Real Sociedad de FÃºtbol B | image = [[File:Real sociedad 200px.png|200px|logo]] | nickname = | founded = 1951 | ground = [[Instalaciones de Zubieta|Zubieta]], [[San SebastiÃ¡n]],
[[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basque Country]], [[Spain]] | capacity = 2,500 | chairman = {{flagicon|Spain}} Jokin Aperribay | manager = {{flagicon|Bosnia and Herzegovina}} [[Meho Kodro]] | league = [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B|2ÂªB - Group 2]] | season = 2010â11| position = [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B|2ÂªB - Group 2]], '''11th''' | pattern_la1=_shouldersonwhite|pattern_b1=_thickwhitestripes|pattern_ra1=_shouldersonwhite | leftarm1=0000FF|body1=0000FF|rightarm1=0000FF|shorts1=FFFFFF|socks1=0000FF | pattern_la2=_navy_stripes|pattern_b2=_navystripes|pattern_ra2=_navy_stripes | leftarm2=000000|body2=000000|rightarm2=000000|shorts2=000000|socks2=000000 | pattern_la3=|pattern_b3=_redhalf|pattern_ra3= | leftarm3=ff0000|body3=ff0000|rightarm3=ff0000|shorts3=ff0000|socks3=ff0000 | current = 2011â12 Segunda DivisiÃ³n B }} '''Real Sociedad de FÃºtbol B''' (also known as '''Sanse''') is a [[List of football clubs in Spain|Spanish football club]] based in [[San SebastiÃ¡n]], in the autonomous community of [[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basque Country]]. Founded in 1951, it is the [[reserve team]] of [[Real Sociedad]], and plays in [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B]], holding home games at ''[[Instalaciones de Zubieta|Zubieta]]''. Unlike in [[English football league system|England]], reserve teams in [[Spanish football league system|Spain]] play in the same football pyramid as their senior team rather than a separate league. However, reserve teams cannot play in the same division as their senior team. Therefore, the team is ineligible for promotion to [[La Liga]], the division in which the main side plays. Reserve teams are also no longer permitted to enter the [[Copa del Rey]]. ==History== Founded as ''San SebastiÃ¡n Club de FÃºtbol'', [[Real Sociedad]]'s B team first reached the [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n|second division]] nine years later. In the [[1961â62 Segunda DivisiÃ³n|1961â62 season]], it achieved its best ever classification in the category after finishing fifth. However, as the main squad was [[1961â62 La Liga|relegated]] in [[La Liga]], it was ineligible for promotion, being relegated instead. In 1980, Real Sociedad B promoted to the newly-created [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B]], remaining in that category 17 consecutive seasons. Afterwards, it fluctuated between divisions three and [[Tercera DivisiÃ³n|four]], reaching the promotion playoffs of the former division in 1991 and 2006, but subsequently falling short. In 1992, a change in rules forced the team to change its name, and it was renamed ''Real Sociedad de FÃºtbol B''. ''[[Liga de FÃºtbol Profesional]]'''s rules prohibit B clubs from having different names from their parent club, the exceptions being [[Real Madrid Castilla]] and [[Sevilla AtlÃ©tico]]. ===Club
